channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose drain cover on junction joining Gauntlet Road to Typhoon Way, 13th January
item.description:
The loose drain cover makes very loud noises when cars drive over it. This is all day and many times through the night. Me and my partner struggle sleeping because of the startling noise and it’s beyond a joke now. It needs fixing for our well-being!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Typhoon Way, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface cracked the whole length of The Poplars, 13th January
item.description:
The road surface has been cracked along the whole length of the Poplars for several years. Each winter it gets progressively worse with only one recent repair that I could see.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Withypool, Up Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip at the Location, 13th January
item.description:
The location is the entrance to the Old Quarry off the Cleeve Common Road. The Flytip consists of a number of sacks - it is not know what they contain as it was seen in passing. Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible so it does not attract more material.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defaced parking signs Courtenay St and Dunalley Parade, Chelteham, 13th January
item.description:
Some more defaced parking restriction signs in St Paul’s zone 11 Cheltenham Outside 4 & 32 Dunalley Parade and outside 36 & 43 Courtenay Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Dunalley Parade, Cheltenham

item.title: Proper road repair needed, 13th January
item.description:
On this section of the road exactly in the curve as you come downhill and going towards A417 there are long standing road surface issues which were never fixed properly for the last 4 years. Recently the potholes were filled up again but there is still a huge level discrepancy which can cause you to loose control of the wheel being in a curve. Please organise for all this section of the road to be fully resurface. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Oxford Cottages A436, Ullenwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big potholes, 13th January
item.description:
On this section of the road as you go towards the roundabout there are several big potholes. Please fix this for us. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wrong road markings, 13th January
item.description:
As you go towards Gloucester, this section of the road it is uphill and situated in a lazy curve without any visibility so you can not overtake but it is marked with interrupted line. So it should be marked with continuous line. Please mend this as it is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big potholes, 13th January
item.description:
As you drive uphill to join the A436 there are big potholes which can cause big car damage if you hit them and even can cause you to loose the control of the wheel. Please fix this for us. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two big potholes, 13th January
item.description:
At this joint on A40 there are two big potholes ...if you hit them you might end up with severe car damage and even might lose control of the wheel. Please fix this for us. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Shipton Cross Rds Cottage A40, Shipton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bottles and cans all over the floor, 13th January
item.description:
Again, cans and bottles dumped across the green. Same types that appear in all the corners in Rowanfield lately Also scattered down the length of Devon Avenue from this spot to Rowanfield exchange. Don't look like they have fallen out of recycling boxes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 50 Devon Avenue, Cheltenham
